revisions.rev:
{{Infobox award | name = Rocky Mountain Emmy Award | image = | imagesize = | caption = Rocky Mountain Emmy Award | description = Excellence in [[television]] | presenter = [[National Academy of Television Arts and Sciences|NATAS]] | State = [[Litchfield Park, Arizona]] | year = 1980 | website = http://www.rockymountainemmy.org/ }}
{{confusing|date=November 2011}} The '''Rocky Mountain Emmy Awards''' are a division of the [[National Academy of Television Arts and Sciences]]. The [[Litchfield Park, Arizona]] division was founded in 1980. In addition to granting the Rocky Mountain [[Emmy Awards]], this division awards scholarships, honors industry veterans at the Silver Circle Celebration, conducts National Student Television Awards of Excellence, has a free research and a nationwide job bank. The chapter also participates in judging Emmy entries at the regional and national levels.<ref name="urlNATAS Rocky Mountain Southwest Chapter: Scholarships">{{cite web |url=http://www.rockymountainemmy.org/scholarships/scholarships.php |title=NATAS Rocky Mountain Southwest Chapter: Scholarships |author= |authorlink= |coauthors= |date= |format= |work= |publisher= |pages= |language= |archiveurl= |archivedate= |quote= |accessdate=2010-07-18}}Scholarships</ref>
==Boundaries==
The academy is divided into the following boundaries and encompasses the states of [[Arizona]], [[New Mexico]], [[Utah]], [[Wyoming]] and [[El Centro, California]]. These boundaries are responsible for the submission of television broadcast materials presented for awards considerations.<ref name="urlNATAS Rocky Mountain Southwest Chapter">{{cite web |url=http://www.rockymountainemmy.org/ |title=NATAS Rocky Mountain Southwest Chapter |author= |authorlink= |coauthors= |date= |format= |work= |publisher= |pages= |language= |archiveurl= |archivedate= |quote= |accessdate=2010-07-18}}Boundaries</ref>
{| class="wikitable" |- | '''State''' || |- | ''Arizona'' |- | ''New Mexico'' || |- | ''California'' || [[El Centro, California]] |- | ''Utah'' || |- | ''Wyoming'' || |- |}
==Board of governors==
The Board of Governors is a working board, which works together collaboratively to ensure they are providing for the best interests of the membership.<ref name="urlNATAS Rocky Mountain Southwest Chapter: Board of Govenors">{{cite web |url=http://www.rockymountainemmy.org/board_of_govenors/board_of_govenors.php |title=NATAS Rocky Mountain Southwest Chapter: Board of Govenors [sic]|author= |authorlink= |coauthors= |date= |format= |work= |publisher= |pages= |language= |archiveurl= |archivedate= |quote= |accessdate=2010-07-18}}Board of Governors</ref>

==Emmy award winners==
Emmy award winners are individuals who show excellence in the field of television. The Emmys are held to the same esteem as the [[Oscar Awards]] are to motion pictures or the [[Grammy Awards]] are to the music industry<ref name="urlNATAS Rocky Mountain Southwest Chapter: Archives">{{cite web |url=http://www.rockymountainemmy.org/archives/archives.php |title=NATAS Rocky Mountain Southwest Chapter: Archives |author= |authorlink= |coauthors= |date= |format= |work= |publisher= |pages= |language= |archiveurl= |archivedate= |quote= |accessdate=2010-07-18}}Emmy Award Winners</ref>
